metadata.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for the bard in the circus playing a flute for the crowd there. Actor does not need to mimic playing the flute - the dialogue 'interrupts' their performance.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load act three, use the debug book to teleport to the Last Days Circus. Violet is performing on the circus grounds, surrounded by a crowd of people.

0.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
0.text: Another bard? Did Lucretious hire you? Tch. Stay out of my way, talentless half-wit.

1.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
1.text: Let's hope a ballad will lift everyone's spirits, eh?
1.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure the player

2.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
2.text: I wonder where the circus will go next? Madam Lucretious said the Shadowfell, but I'm pretty sure she was joking...

3.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
3.text: Aren't you the adoring fan? Can't talk - I'm in the middle of a performance!

4.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
4.text: I - I'm supposed to keep playing no matter what, but what the hells is going on?
4.context: NodeContext: nervous, she can hear fighting nearby

5.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
5.text: Viola Silvertongue - at your service. Or I will be, once my set is done!

6.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
6.text: We're leaving already? I was this close to performing in the Elfsong. Oh well - enjoy my dulcet tones while you can!
6.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure the player

7.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
7.text: The, ah, attack is nothing to worry about - Madam Lucretious has everything under control. Enjoy the circus!
7.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure the player

8.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
8.text: We've got plenty bards as is - so talk a long walk off a short cliff, yeah?
